attributes.action: Stop British Waterways from charging Continuous Cruisers and Wide Beam boats any surcharges on top of the standard boat licence fee and to stop British Waterways from introducing a Roving Mooring Permit.
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background: To justify these proposals BW states that most continuous cruisers are using their boat as their home, do not have any other accommodation costs and consequently have a higher willingness to pay. When the consequence of not paying the boat licence fee is having one’s boat destroyed and thus losing one’s home, this amounts to extortion.

government_responses.details:
You signed a petition asking the Prime Minister to "Stop British Waterways from charging Continuous Cruisers and Wide Beam boats any surcharges on top of the standard boat licence fee and to stop British Waterways from introducing a Roving Mooring Permit."

The Prime Minister's Office has responded to that petition and you can view it here: 

http://www.number10.gov.uk/Page21921
